1. Undercarriage retracted
2. Undercarriage extended
3. Flaps up
4. Flaps in take-off position
5. All engines at take-off thrust
6. Operative engine(s) at take-off thrust
7. Climbing speed of V2 + 10 kts
8. Climbing speed of 1.3x VS
9. Climbing speed of V2
10.Commencing height 35 ft.

Example: W/V 330/30Runway 02Wind angle = 50°
Regarding take-off distances and speeds for take-off, which of the following is correct?

options.text: At the runway limited take off mass for balanced field there is a single speed for V1.

the balanced V1 is the maximum speed at which neither the one engine out TOD nor
TOR are exceeded.

for a balanced field, the balanced V1 would result in the same ASD, one engine out
TOD and one engine out TOR.

For a balanced field, the balanced V1 would result in the same ASD, all engine TOD
and all engine TOR.

variant.question: When must you apply a runway lineup correction?

options.text: Anytime positioning of the aircraft on the runway does not permit the aircraft to start the takeoff roll at the start of the threshold.
When the runway has an upslope.
When the aircraft fuselage length exceeds a certain limit.
It isn't required when the runway is not field length limited.

Runway 30 is in use and the threshold elevation is 2139 feet, threshold elevation of runway 12 is 2289 feet. Take-off run available is 1720 metres and clearway is 280 metres. 
What is the slope of the runway in use?

options.text: increases, and the Climb-Limited Take-Off Mass decreases.
increases, and the Climb-Limited Take-Off Mass increases.
decreases, and the Climb-Limited Take-Off Mass decreases.
decreases, and the Climb-Limited Take-Off Mass increases.

variant.question: What statement regarding screen height is true, when taking off from a wet runway with a performance class A aeroplane?

options.text: The screen height may be lowered to 15 feet for calculation of the one engine inoperative TOD.
The screen height may only be lowered to 15 feet if taking off from a runway defined as a limited length runway.
The screen height may be lowered to 15 feet and MTOM may then be higher than on a dry runway of equal length.
The screen height may be lowered to 15 feet for calculation of the all engine TOD.

variant.question: What statement regarding screen height is true, when taking off from a wet runway with a performance class A aeroplane?

options.text: The screen height may be lowered to 15 feet for the calculation of the one engine inoperative TOD.
The screen height may be lowered to 15 feet for the calculation of the all engine TOD.
The screen height may be lowered to 15 feet and MTOM may then be higher than on a dry runway of equal length.
The screen height may only be lowered to 15 feet if taking off from a runway defined as a limited length runway.

variant.question: When calculating the Accelerate Stop Distance Required ASDR, which of the following assumptions is made? The pilot takes the first action to reject the takeoff ...

options.text: 2 seconds before V1 to start the deceleration at V2

variant.question: When calculating the Accelerate Stop Distance Required ASDR, which of the following assumptions is made? The pilot takes the first action to reject the takeoff ...

options.text: 2 seconds before V~1~ to start the deceleration at V~2~

variant.question: Whilst approaching to land, your instruments indicate an unexpected headwind. What do you expect will happen to your ground speed, and how should you respond?

options.text: Ground speed decreases; reduce the rate of descent.
Ground speed increases; increase the rate of descent.
Ground speed increases; reduce the rate of descent.
Ground speed decreases; increase the rate of descent.

variant.question:
The pilot decides to increase V2
Does this have any effect on the 35 ft screen height?

options.text: The 35 ft screen height is located further down along the runway.
The distance from the beginning of the take-off roll to the location of the screen height will be shorter.
The screen height and the location of the screen height along the runway will not change.
The screen height will be increased to 50 ft.

variant.question: An airport has a 3 000 metres long runway, and a 2 000 metres clearway at each end of that runway. For the calculation of the maximum allowed Take-off Mass, the take-off distance available cannot be greater than:

An airplane takes off from a runway which is contaminated with compressed snow. What happens to the take-off and stop distances?

options.text: TODR remains the same and ASDR increases.

variant.question: An aeroplane takes off from a runway which is contaminated with compressed snow. What happens to the take-off and stop distances?

options.text: TODR remains the same and ASDR increases.
